title: Asian cucumber salad

ingredients.content: ½ Chinese cabbage, cut into pieces
1 red capsicum, deseeded and cut into pieces
1 spring onion/shallot, trimmed and cut into pieces
1 fresh long red chilli, trimmed, cut into halves and deseeded if preferred (optional)
1 ½ tbsp tamari, gluten free (see Tips)
50 g Japanese pickled ginger, cut into julienne

preparations.content: Place Chinese cabbage into mixing bowl and chop <b>2 sec/speed 5<b>.  Transfer into a large bowl.

Place capsicum into mixing bowl and chop <b>2 sec/speed 4<b>. Transfer into large bowl with the cabbage, then add cucumber, carrot, coriander and mint. Place the bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh peanuts into it. Toss to combine, then set aside.
Place spring onions/shallots, ginger, garlic and chilli (optional) into mixing bowl and chop <b>5 sec/speed 6<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add tamari, miso, lime juice and sugar and mix <b>10 sec/speed 6<b>. Pour dressing over Cucumber salad and toss to combine (see Tips). Garnish with pickled ginger and coriander before serving.

hintsAndTricks: You can purchase spiralisers at most kitchenware stores or at The Mix Shop™ (www.thermomix.com.au/shop or www.thermomix.co.nz/shop).
Be sure to check the label of your tamari, as not all brands are gluten free.
You can find pickled ginger in the international aisle of most major supermarkets.
We recommend dressing the salad just before serving. If making ahead of time, store salad and dressing separately.
We served this salad with our Burmese chickpea tofu with spicy dressing (refer to the recipe on this recipe chip).
